.AlluxioCompTemplateSpec.description: AlluxioCompTemplateSpec is a description of the Alluxio commponents

enabled.description: Enabled or Disabled for the components. For now, only  API Gateway is enabled or disabled.

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by Alluxio component.

networkMode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the master to fit on a node

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to Alluxio's pods

ports.description: Ports used by Alluxio(e.g. rpc: 19998 for master)

properties.description:
Configurable properties for the Alluxio component.
Refer to Alluxio Configuration Properties for more info

replicas.description: Replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given template. If unspecified, defaults to 1. replicas is the min replicas of dataset in the cluster

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by the Alluxio component.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into the alluxio runtime component's filesystem.

.AlluxioFuseSpec.description: AlluxioFuseSpec is a description of the Alluxio Fuse

args.description: Arguments that will be passed to Alluxio Fuse

cleanPolicy.description: CleanPolicy decides when to clean Alluxio Fuse pods. Currently Fluid supports two policies: OnDemand and OnRuntimeDeleted OnDemand cleans fuse pod once the fuse pod on some node is not needed OnRuntimeDeleted cleans fuse pod only when the cache runtime is deleted Defaults to OnRuntimeDeleted

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by Alluxio Fuse

global.description: If the fuse client should be deployed in global mode, otherwise the affinity should be considered

networkMode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the fuse client to fit on a node, this option only effect when global is enabled

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to Alluxio's fuse pods

properties.description:
Configurable properties for Alluxio System.
Refer to Alluxio Configuration Properties for more info

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by Alluxio Fuse.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into the alluxio runtime component's filesystem.

.AlluxioRuntime.description: AlluxioRuntime is the Schema for the alluxioruntimes API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

.AlluxioRuntimeList.description: AlluxioRuntimeList contains a list of AlluxioRuntime

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

.AlluxioRuntimeSpec.description: AlluxioRuntimeSpec defines the desired state of AlluxioRuntime

alluxioVersion.description: The version information that instructs fluid to orchestrate a particular version of Alluxio.

apiGateway.description: The component spec of Alluxio API Gateway

data.description: Management strategies for the dataset to which the runtime is bound

disablePrometheus.description: Disable monitoring for Alluxio Runtime Prometheus is enabled by default

fuse.description: The component spec of Alluxio Fuse

hadoopConfig.description: Name of the configMap used to support HDFS configurations when using HDFS as Alluxio's UFS. The configMap must be in the same namespace with the AlluxioRuntime. The configMap should contain user-specific HDFS conf files in it. For now, only "hdfs-site.xml" and "core-site.xml" are supported. It must take the filename of the conf file as the key and content of the file as the value.

jobMaster.description: The component spec of Alluxio job master

jobWorker.description: The component spec of Alluxio job Worker

management.description: RuntimeManagement defines policies when managing the runtime

master.description: The component spec of Alluxio master

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to Alluxio's pods

properties.description:
Configurable properties for Alluxio system.
Refer to Alluxio Configuration Properties for more info

replicas.description: The replicas of the worker, need to be specified

runAs.description: Manage the user to run Alluxio Runtime

volumes.description: Volumes is the list of Kubernetes volumes that can be mounted by the alluxio runtime components and/or fuses.

worker.description: The component spec of Alluxio worker

.CacheableNodeAffinity.description: CacheableNodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this dataset can be cached to.

required.description: Required specifies hard node constraints that must be met.

.CleanCachePolicy.description: CleanCachePolicy defines policies when cleaning cache

gracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the cache needs to clean gracefully. May be decreased in delete runtime request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates clean immediately via the timeout command (no opportunity to shut down). If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with timeout command. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Optional max retry Attempts when cleanCache function returns an error after execution, runtime attempts to run it three more times by default. With Maximum Retry Attempts, you can customize the maximum number of retries. This gives you the option to continue processing retries.

.Condition.description: Condition explains the transitions on phase

lastProbeTime.description: LastProbeTime describes last time this condition was updated.

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime describes last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: Message is a human-readable message indicating details about the transition

reason.description: Reason for the condition's last transition

status.description: Status of the condition, one of `True`, `False` or `Unknown`

pin.description: Pin the dataset or not. Refer to Alluxio User-CLI pin

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector defiens node selector for DataLoad pod

options.description: Options specifies the extra dataload properties for runtime

resources.description: Resources that will be requested by the DataLoad job.

runAfter.description: Specifies that the preceding operation in a workflow

schedule.description: The schedule in Cron format, only set when policy is cron, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron.

schedulerName.description: SchedulerName sets the scheduler to be used for DataLoad pod

target.description: Target defines target paths that needs to be loaded

tolerations.description: Tolerations defines tolerations for DataLoad pod

ttlSecondsAfterFinished.description: TTLSecondsAfterFinished is the time second to clean up data operations after finished or failed

.DataMigrateSpec.description: DataMigrateSpec defines the desired state of DataMigrate

affinity.description: Affinity defines affinity for DataLoad pod

block.description: if dataMigrate blocked dataset usage, default is false

from.description: data to migrate source, including dataset and external storage

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector defiens node selector for DataLoad pod

options.description: options for migrate, different for each runtime

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to DataLoad pods

policy.description: policy for migrate, including Once, Cron, OnEvent

resources.description: Resources that will be requested by the DataMigrate job.

runAfter.description: Specifies that the preceding operation in a workflow

runtimeType.description: using which runtime to migrate data; if none, take dataset runtime as default

schedule.description: The schedule in Cron format, only set when policy is cron, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron.

schedulerName.description: SchedulerName sets the scheduler to be used for DataLoad pod

to.description: data to migrate destination, including dataset and external storage

tolerations.description: Tolerations defines tolerations for DataLoad pod

ttlSecondsAfterFinished.description: TTLSecondsAfterFinished is the time second to clean up data operations after finished or failed

.DatasetCondition.description: Condition describes the state of the cache at a certain point.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

lastUpdateTime.description: The last time this condition was updated.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

.DatasetList.description: DatasetList contains a list of Dataset

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

.DatasetSpec.description: DatasetSpec defines the desired state of Dataset

accessModes.description: AccessModes contains all ways the volume backing the PVC can be mounted

dataRestoreLocation.description: DataRestoreLocation is the location to load data of dataset  been backuped

mounts.description: Mount Points to be mounted on Alluxio.

nodeAffinity.description: NodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this dataset can be cached to. This field influences the scheduling of pods that use the cached dataset.

placement.description: Manage switch for opening Multiple datasets single node deployment or not

sharedEncryptOptions.description: SharedEncryptOptions is the encryptOption to all mount

sharedOptions.description: SharedOptions is the options to all mount

.DatasetStatus.description: DatasetStatus defines the observed state of Dataset

cacheStates.description: CacheStatus represents the total resources of the dataset.

conditions.description: Conditions is an array of current observed conditions.

dataBackupRef.description: DataBackupRef specifies the running Backup job that targets this Dataset. This is mainly used as a lock to prevent concurrent DataBackup jobs. Deprecated, use OperationRef instead

dataLoadRef.description: DataLoadRef specifies the running DataLoad job that targets this Dataset. This is mainly used as a lock to prevent concurrent DataLoad jobs. Deprecated, use OperationRef instead

datasetRef.description: DatasetRef specifies the datasets namespaced name mounting this Dataset.

fileNum.description: FileNum represents the file numbers of the dataset

mounts.description: the info of mount points have been mounted

operationRef.description: OperationRef specifies the Operation that targets this Dataset. This is mainly used as a lock to prevent concurrent same Operation jobs.

phase.description: Dataset Phase. One of the four phases: `Pending`, `Bound`, `NotBound` and `Failed`

ufsTotal.description: Total in GB of dataset in the cluster

.EFCCompTemplateSpec.description: EFCCompTemplateSpec is a description of the EFC components

disabled.description: Enabled or Disabled for the components. Default enable.

networkMode.description: Whether to use host network or not.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the component to fit on a node.

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to EFC's master and worker pods

ports.description: Ports used by EFC(e.g. rpc: 19998 for master).

properties.description: Configurable properties for the EFC component.

replicas.description: Replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given template. If unspecified, defaults to 1. replicas is the min replicas of dataset in the cluster

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by the EFC component.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

version.description: The version information that instructs fluid to orchestrate a particular version of EFC Comp

.EFCFuseSpec.description: EFCFuseSpec is a description of the EFC Fuse

cleanPolicy.description: CleanPolicy decides when to clean EFC Fuse pods. Currently Fluid supports two policies: OnDemand and OnRuntimeDeleted OnDemand cleans fuse pod once th fuse pod on some node is not needed OnRuntimeDeleted cleans fuse pod only when the cache runtime is deleted Defaults to OnRuntimeDeleted

networkMode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the fuse client to fit on a node, this option only effect when global is enabled

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to EFC's fuse pods

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by EFC Fuse.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

version.description: The version information that instructs fluid to orchestrate a particular version of EFC Fuse

fuse.description: The component spec of EFC Fuse

master.description: The component spec of EFC master

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to all EFC's pods

replicas.description: The replicas of the worker, need to be specified

tieredstore.description: Tiered storage used by EFC worker

worker.description: The component spec of EFC worker

.ExternalEndpointSpec.description: ExternalEndpointSpec defines the configurations for external etcd cluster

encryptOptions.description: encrypt info for accessing the external etcd cluster

options.description: Configurable options for External Etcd cluster.

uri.description: URI specifies the endpoint of external Etcd cluster E,g. "etcd-svc.etcd-namespace.svc.cluster.local:2379" Default is not set and use http protocol to connect to external etcd cluster
type of external storage, including s3, oss, gcs, ceph, nfs, pvc, etc. (related to runtime)

.GooseFSCompTemplateSpec.description: GooseFSCompTemplateSpec is a description of the GooseFS commponents

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

enabled.description: Enabled or Disabled for the components. For now, only  API Gateway is enabled or disabled.

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by GooseFS component.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the master to fit on a node

ports.description: Ports used by GooseFS(e.g. rpc: 19998 for master)

properties.description:
Configurable properties for the GOOSEFS component.
Refer to GOOSEFS Configuration Properties for more info

replicas.description: Replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given template. If unspecified, defaults to 1. replicas is the min replicas of dataset in the cluster

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by the GooseFS component.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

global.description: If the fuse client should be deployed in global mode, otherwise the affinity should be considered

imageTag.description: Image Tag for GooseFS Fuse(e.g. v1.0.1)

args.description: Arguments that will be passed to Jindo Fuse

cleanPolicy.description: CleanPolicy decides when to clean JindoFS Fuse pods. Currently Fluid supports two policies: OnDemand and OnRuntimeDeleted OnDemand cleans fuse pod once th fuse pod on some node is not needed OnRuntimeDeleted cleans fuse pod only when the cache runtime is deleted Defaults to OnRuntimeDeleted

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by Jindo Fuse

global.description: If the fuse client should be deployed in global mode, otherwise the affinity should be considered

labels.description: Labels will be added on all the JindoFS pods. DEPRECATED: this is a deprecated field. Please use PodMetadata.Labels instead. Note: this field is set to be exclusive with PodMetadata.Labels

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the fuse client to fit on a node, this option only effect when global is enabled

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to Jindo's fuse pods

resources.description:
Resources that will be requested by Jindo Fuse.

Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

fuse.description: The component spec of Jindo Fuse

hadoopConfig.description: Name of the configMap used to support HDFS configurations when using HDFS as Jindo's UFS. The configMap must be in the same namespace with the JindoRuntime. The configMap should contain user-specific HDFS conf files in it. For now, only "hdfs-site.xml" and "core-site.xml" are supported. It must take the filename of the conf file as the key and content of the file as the value.

jindoVersion.description: The version information that instructs fluid to orchestrate a particular version of Jindo.

labels.description: Labels will be added on all the JindoFS pods. DEPRECATED: this is a deprecated field. Please use PodMetadata.Labels instead. Note: this field is set to be exclusive with PodMetadata.Labels

networkmode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

disablePrometheus.description: Disable monitoring for JuiceFS Runtime Prometheus is enabled by default

jobWorker.description: The component spec of JuiceFS job Worker

juicefsVersion.description: The version information that instructs fluid to orchestrate a particular version of JuiceFS.

master.description: The component spec of JuiceFS master

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations that will be propagated to JuiceFs's pods.

replicas.description: The replicas of the worker, need to be specified

runAs.description: Manage the user to run Juicefs Runtime

volumes.description: Volumes is the list of Kubernetes volumes that can be mounted by the alluxio runtime components and/or fuses.

worker.description: The component spec of JuiceFS worker

.Level.description:
Level describes configurations a tier needs.
Refer to Configuring Tiered Storage for more info

high.description: Ratio of high watermark of the tier (e.g. 0.9)

low.description: Ratio of low watermark of the tier (e.g. 0.7)

mediumtype.description: Medium Type of the tier. One of the three types: `MEM`, `SSD`, `HDD`

path.description: File paths to be used for the tier. Multiple paths are supported. Multiple paths should be separated with comma. For example: "/mnt/cache1,/mnt/cache2".

quota.description: Quota for the whole tier. (e.g. 100Gi) Please note that if there're multiple paths used for this tierstore, the quota will be equally divided into these paths. If you'd like to set quota for each, path, see QuotaList for more information.

quotaList.description: QuotaList are quotas used to set quota on multiple paths. Quotas should be separated with comma. Quotas in this list will be set to paths with the same order in Path. For example, with Path defined with "/mnt/cache1,/mnt/cache2" and QuotaList set to "100Gi, 50Gi", then we get 100GiB cache storage under "/mnt/cache1" and 50GiB under "/mnt/cache2". Also note that num of quotas must be consistent with the num of paths defined in Path.

volumeSource.description: VolumeSource is the volume source of the tier. It follows the form of corev1.VolumeSource. For now, users should only specify VolumeSource when VolumeType is set to emptyDir.

volumeType.description: VolumeType is the volume type of the tier. Should be one of the three types: `hostPath`, `emptyDir` and `volumeTemplate`. If not set, defaults to hostPath.

.MasterSpec.description: MasterSpec defines the configurations for Vineyard Master component which is also regarded as the Etcd component in Vineyard. For more info about Vineyard, refer to Vineyard

endpoint.description:
ExternalEndpoint defines the configurations for external etcd cluster Default is not set If set, the Vineyard Master component will not be deployed, which means the Vineyard Worker component will use an external Etcd cluster. E,g.
  endpoint:
    uri: "etcd-svc.etcd-namespace.svc.cluster.local:2379"
    encryptOptions:
      - name: access-key
		   valueFrom:
          secretKeyRef:
            name: etcd-secret
			   key: accesskey

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by Vineyard component. For Master, refer to Etcd Configuration for more info Default is not set.

image.description: The image of Vineyard component. For Master, the default image is `bitnami/etcd` For Worker, the default image is `vineyardcloudnative/vineyardd` The default container registry is `docker.io`, you can change it by setting the image field

imagePullPolicy.description: The image pull policy of Vineyard component. Default is `IfNotPresent`.

imageTag.description: The image tag of Vineyard component. For Master, the default image tag is `3.5.10`. For Worker, the default image tag is `latest`.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector to choose which nodes to launch the Vineyard component. E,g. {"disktype": "ssd"}

options.description:
Configurable options for Vineyard component. For Master, there is no configurable options. For Worker, support the following options.

  vineyardd.reserve.memory: (Bool) where to reserve memory for vineyardd
                            If set to true, the memory quota will be counted to the vineyardd rather than the application.
  etcd.prefix: (String) the prefix of etcd key for vineyard objects
  wait.etcd.timeout: (String) the timeout period before waiting the etcd to be ready, in seconds

  Default value is as follows.

    vineyardd.reserve.memory: "true"
    etcd.prefix: "/vineyard"
    wait.etcd.timeout: "120"

ports.description: Ports used by Vineyard component. For Master, the default client port is 2379 and peer port is 2380. For Worker, the default rpc port is 9600 and the default exporter port is 9144.

replicas.description: The replicas of Vineyard component. If not specified, defaults to 1. For worker, the replicas should not be greater than the number of nodes in the cluster

resources.description: Resources contains the resource requirements and limits for the Vineyard component. Default is not set. For Worker, when the options contains vineyardd.reserve.memory=true, the resources.request.memory for worker should be greater than tieredstore.levels[0].quota(aka vineyardd shared memory)

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into the vineyard runtime component's filesystem. It is useful for specifying a persistent storage. Default is not set.

.Metadata.description: Metadata defines subgroup properties of metav1.ObjectMeta

annotations.description: Annotations are annotations of pod specification

labels.description: Labels are labels of pod specification

.MetadataSyncPolicy.description: MetadataSyncPolicy defines policies when syncing metadata

autoSync.description: AutoSync enables automatic metadata sync when setting up a runtime. If not set, it defaults to true.

.Mount.description:
Mount describes a mounting.
Refer to Alluxio Storage Integrations for more info

mountPoint.description: MountPoint is the mount point of source.

options.description:
The Mount Options.
Refer to Mount Options.
The option has Prefix 'fs.' And you can Learn more from The Storage Integrations

path.description: The path of mount, if not set will be /{Name}

.OSAdvise.description: OSAdvise is a description of choices to have optimization on specific operating system

enabled.description: Enable operating system optimization not enabled by default.

osVersion.description: Specific operating system version that can have optimization.

apiVersion.description: API version of the referent operation

kind.description: Kind specifies the type of the referent operation

name.description: Name specifies the name of the referent operation

namespace.description: Namespace specifies the namespace of the referent operation.

.OperationStatus.description: OperationStatus defines the observed state of operation

conditions.description: Conditions consists of transition information on operation's Phase

duration.description: Duration tell user how much time was spent to operation

lastScheduleTime.description: LastScheduleTime is the last time the cron operation was scheduled

lastSuccessfulTime.description: LastSuccessfulTime is the last time the cron operation successfully completed

phase.description: Phase describes current phase of operation

waitingFor.description: WaitingStatus stores information about waiting operation.

.PodMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines subgroup properties of metav1.ObjectMeta

annotations.description: Annotations are annotations of pod specification

labels.description: Labels are labels of pod specification

.Processor.description: Processor defines the actual processor for DataProcess. Processor can be either of a Job or a Shell script.

job.description: Job represents a processor which runs DataProcess as a job.

podMetadata.description: PodMetadata defines labels and annotations on the processor pod.

script.description: Shell represents a processor which executes shell script

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName defiens the serviceAccountName of the container

.Runtime.description: Runtime describes a runtime to be used to support dataset

category.description: Category the runtime object belongs to (e.g. Accelerate)

.RuntimeCondition.description: Condition describes the state of the cache at a certain point.

lastProbeTime.description: The last time this condition was updated.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

.RuntimeManagement.description: RuntimeManagement defines suggestions for runtime controllers to manage the runtime

cleanCachePolicy.description: CleanCachePolicy defines the policy of cleaning cache when shutting down the runtime

metadataSyncPolicy.description: MetadataSyncPolicy defines the policy of syncing metadata when setting up the runtime. If not set,

.RuntimeStatus.description: RuntimeStatus defines the observed state of Runtime

apiGateway.description: APIGatewayStatus represents rest api gateway status

cacheAffinity.description: CacheAffinity represents the runtime worker pods node affinity including node selector

cacheStates.description: CacheStatus represents the total resources of the dataset.

conditions.description: Represents the latest available observations of a ddc runtime's current state.

currentFuseNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that can be running the runtime Fuse pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime Fuse pod).

currentMasterNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that should be running the runtime pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime master pod).

currentWorkerNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that can be running the runtime worker pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime worker pod).

desiredFuseNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that should be running the runtime Fuse pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime Fuse pod).

desiredMasterNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that should be running the runtime pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime master pod).

desiredWorkerNumberScheduled.description: The total number of nodes that should be running the runtime worker pod (including nodes correctly running the runtime worker pod).

fuseNumberAvailable.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime Fuse pod and have one or more of the runtime Fuse pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

fuseNumberReady.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime Fuse pod and have one or more of the runtime Fuse pod running and ready.

fuseNumberUnavailable.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime fuse pod and have none of the runtime fuse pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

fusePhase.description: FusePhase is the Fuse running phase

fuseReason.description: Reason for the condition's last transition.

masterNumberReady.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime worker pod and have zero or more of the runtime master pod running and ready.

masterPhase.description: MasterPhase is the master running phase

mountTime.description: MountTime represents time last mount happened if Mounttime is earlier than master starting time, remount will be required

mounts.description: MountPoints represents the mount points specified in the bounded dataset

setupDuration.description: Duration tell user how much time was spent to setup the runtime

valueFile.description: config map used to set configurations

workerNumberAvailable.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime worker pod and have one or more of the runtime worker pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

workerNumberReady.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime worker pod and have one or more of the runtime worker pod running and ready.

workerNumberUnavailable.description: The number of nodes that should be running the runtime worker pod and have none of the runtime worker pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

workerPhase.description: WorkerPhase is the worker running phase

env.description: List of environment variables to set in the container.

resources.description: Resources that will be requested by the DataProcess job.

restartPolicy.description: RestartPolicy specifies the processor job's restart policy. Only "Never", "OnFailure" is allowed.

volumeMounts.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem.

volumes.description: List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod.

key.description: The required key in the secret

.TargetDataset.description: TargetDataset defines the target dataset of the DataLoad

name.description: Name defines name of the target dataset

namespace.description: Namespace defines namespace of the target dataset

.TargetDatasetWithMountPath.description: TargetDataset defines which dataset will be processed by DataProcess. Under the hood, the dataset's pvc will be mounted to the given mountPath of the DataProcess's containers.

mountPath.description: MountPath defines where the Dataset should be mounted in DataProcess's containers.

name.description: Name defines name of the target dataset

namespace.description: Namespace defines namespace of the target dataset

subPath.description: SubPath defines subpath of the target dataset to mount.

.TargetPath.description: TargetPath defines the target path of the DataLoad

path.description: Path defines path to be load

replicas.description: Replicas defines how many replicas will be loaded

.ThinCompTemplateSpec.description: ThinCompTemplateSpec is a description of the thinRuntime components

enabled.description: Enabled or Disabled for the components.

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by thinRuntime component.

networkMode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

replicas.description: Replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given template. If unspecified, defaults to 1. replicas is the min replicas of dataset in the cluster

resources.description: Resources that will be requested by thinRuntime component.

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into runtime component's filesystem.

args.description: Arguments that will be passed to thinRuntime Fuse

cleanPolicy.description: CleanPolicy decides when to clean thinRuntime Fuse pods. Currently Fluid supports two policies: OnDemand and OnRuntimeDeleted OnDemand cleans fuse pod once the fuse pod on some node is not needed OnRuntimeDeleted cleans fuse pod only when the cache runtime is deleted Defaults to OnDemand

command.description: Command that will be passed to thinRuntime Fuse

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by thinRuntime Fuse

networkMode.description: Whether to use hostnetwork or not

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the fuse client to fit on a node, this option only effect when global is enabled

options.description: Options configurable options of FUSE client, performance parameters usually. will be merged with Dataset.spec.mounts.options into fuse pod.

resources.description: Resources that will be requested by thinRuntime Fuse.

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into the thinruntime component's filesystem.

disablePrometheus.description: Disable monitoring for Runtime Prometheus is enabled by default

profileName.description: The specific runtime profile name, empty value is used for handling datasets which mount another dataset

.VersionSpec.description: VersionSpec represents the settings for the  version that fluid is orchestrating.

.VineyardCompTemplateSpec.description: VineyardCompTemplateSpec is the common configurations for vineyard components including Master and Worker.

env.description: Environment variables that will be used by Vineyard component. For Master, refer to Etcd Configuration for more info Default is not set.

image.description: The image of Vineyard component. For Master, the default image is `bitnami/etcd` For Worker, the default image is `vineyardcloudnative/vineyardd` The default container registry is `docker.io`, you can change it by setting the image field

imagePullPolicy.description: The image pull policy of Vineyard component. Default is `IfNotPresent`.

imageTag.description: The image tag of Vineyard component. For Master, the default image tag is `3.5.10`. For Worker, the default image tag is `latest`.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector to choose which nodes to launch the Vineyard component. E,g. {"disktype": "ssd"}

options.description:
Configurable options for Vineyard component. For Master, there is no configurable options. For Worker, support the following options.

  vineyardd.reserve.memory: (Bool) where to reserve memory for vineyardd
                            If set to true, the memory quota will be counted to the vineyardd rather than the application.
  etcd.prefix: (String) the prefix of etcd key for vineyard objects
  wait.etcd.timeout: (String) the timeout period before waiting the etcd to be ready, in seconds

  Default value is as follows.

    vineyardd.reserve.memory: "true"
    etcd.prefix: "/vineyard"
    wait.etcd.timeout: "120"

ports.description: Ports used by Vineyard component. For Master, the default client port is 2379 and peer port is 2380. For Worker, the default rpc port is 9600 and the default exporter port is 9144.

replicas.description: The replicas of Vineyard component. If not specified, defaults to 1. For worker, the replicas should not be greater than the number of nodes in the cluster

resources.description: Resources contains the resource requirements and limits for the Vineyard component. Default is not set. For Worker, when the options contains vineyardd.reserve.memory=true, the resources.request.memory for worker should be greater than tieredstore.levels[0].quota(aka vineyardd shared memory)

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts specifies the volumes listed in ".spec.volumes" to mount into the vineyard runtime component's filesystem. It is useful for specifying a persistent storage. Default is not set.

.VineyardRuntime.description: VineyardRuntime is the Schema for the VineyardRuntimes API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

.VineyardRuntimeList.description: VineyardRuntimeList contains a list of VineyardRuntime

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

.VineyardRuntimeSpec.description: VineyardRuntimeSpec defines the desired state of VineyardRuntime

disablePrometheus.description: Disable monitoring metrics for Vineyard Runtime Default is false

fuse.description: Fuse holds the configurations for Vineyard client socket. Note that the "Fuse" here is kept just for API consistency, VineyardRuntime mount a socket file instead of a FUSE filesystem to make data cache available. Applications can connect to the vineyard runtime components through IPC or RPC. IPC is the default way to connect to vineyard runtime components, which is more efficient than RPC. If the socket file is not mounted, the connection will fall back to RPC.

master.description: Master holds the configurations for Vineyard Master component Represents the Etcd component in Vineyard

tieredstore.description:
Tiered storage used by vineyardd The MediumType can only be `MEM` and `SSD` `MEM` actually represents the shared memory of vineyardd. `SSD` represents the external storage of vineyardd. Default is as follows.
  tieredstore:
    levels:
    - level: 0
      mediumtype: MEM
      quota: 4Gi

Choose hostpath as the external storage of vineyardd.
  tieredstore:
    levels:
	   - level: 0
      mediumtype: MEM
      quota: 4Gi
		 high: "0.8"
      low: "0.3"
    - level: 1
      mediumtype: SSD
      quota: 10Gi
      volumeType: Hostpath
      path: /var/spill-path

volumes.description: Volumes is the list of Kubernetes volumes that can be mounted by the vineyard components (Master and Worker). Default is null.

worker.description: Worker holds the configurations for Vineyard Worker component Represents the Vineyardd component in Vineyard

.VineyardSockSpec.description: VineyardSockSpec holds the configurations for vineyard client socket

cleanPolicy.description: CleanPolicy decides when to clean Vineyard Fuse pods. Currently Fluid supports two policies: OnDemand and OnRuntimeDeleted OnDemand cleans fuse pod once th fuse pod on some node is not needed OnRuntimeDeleted cleans fuse pod only when the cache runtime is deleted Defaults to OnRuntimeDeleted

image.description: Image for Vineyard Fuse Default is `vineyardcloudnative/vineyard-mount-socket`

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy for Vineyard Fuse Default is `IfNotPresent` Available values are `Always`, `IfNotPresent`, `Never`

imageTag.description: Image Tag for Vineyard Fuse Default is `latest`

resources.description: Resources contains the resource requirements and limits for the Vineyard Fuse. Default is not set.

.VolumeSource.description: VolumeSource defines volume source and volume claim template.

awsElasticBlockStore.description: AWSElasticBlockStore represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

azureDisk.description: AzureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

azureFile.description: AzureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

cephfs.description: CephFS represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

cinder.description: Cinder represents a cinder volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

configMap.description: ConfigMap represents a configMap that should populate this volume

csi.description: CSI (Container Storage Interface) represents ephemeral storage that is handled by certain external CSI drivers (Beta feature).

downwardAPI.description: DownwardAPI represents downward API about the pod that should populate this volume

emptyDir.description: EmptyDir represents a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#emptydir

ephemeral.description:
Ephemeral represents a volume that is handled by a cluster storage driver. The volume's lifecycle is tied to the pod that defines it - it will be created before the pod starts, and deleted when the pod is removed.

Use this if: a) the volume is only needed while the pod runs, b) features of normal volumes like restoring from snapshot or capacity
   tracking are needed,
c) the storage driver is specified through a storage class, and d) the storage driver supports dynamic volume provisioning through
   a PersistentVolumeClaim (see EphemeralVolumeSource for more
   information on the connection between this volume type
   and PersistentVolumeClaim).

Use PersistentVolumeClaim or one of the vendor-specific APIs for volumes that persist for longer than the lifecycle of an individual pod.

Use CSI for light-weight local ephemeral volumes if the CSI driver is meant to be used that way - see the documentation of the driver for more information.

A pod can use both types of ephemeral volumes and persistent volumes at the same time.

fc.description: FC represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.

flexVolume.description: FlexVolume represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin.

flocker.description: Flocker represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine. This depends on the Flocker control service being running

gcePersistentDisk.description: GCEPersistentDisk represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

gitRepo.description: GitRepo represents a git repository at a particular revision. DEPRECATED: GitRepo is deprecated. To provision a container with a git repo, mount an EmptyDir into an InitContainer that clones the repo using git, then mount the EmptyDir into the Pod's container.

glusterfs.description: Glusterfs represents a Glusterfs mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md

hostPath.description: HostPath represents a pre-existing file or directory on the host machine that is directly exposed to the container. This is generally used for system agents or other privileged things that are allowed to see the host machine. Most containers will NOT need this. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath

iscsi.description: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/iscsi/README.md

nfs.description: NFS represents an NFS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs

persistentVolumeClaim.description: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource represents a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

photonPersistentDisk.description: PhotonPersistentDisk represents a PhotonController persistent disk attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

portworxVolume.description: PortworxVolume represents a portworx volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

projected.description: Items for all in one resources secrets, configmaps, and downward API

quobyte.description: Quobyte represents a Quobyte mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

rbd.description: RBD represents a Rados Block Device mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md

scaleIO.description: ScaleIO represents a ScaleIO persistent volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

secret.description: Secret represents a secret that should populate this volume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#secret

storageos.description: StorageOS represents a StorageOS volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

vsphereVolume.description: VsphereVolume represents a vSphere volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

operationComplete.description: OperationComplete indicates if the preceding operation is complete
